title: Canada's Manulife reports decline in fourth-quarter earnings
text:
February 7, 2018 / 10:13 PM / in 43 minutes Canada's Manulife reports decline in fourth-quarter earnings Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
TORONTO, Feb 7 (Reuters) - Canadaâ€™s biggest insurer Manulife Financial Corp on Wednesday reported a decline in fourth-quarter earnings, reflecting lower insurance sales and slower growth at its wealth and asset management business. 
Manulife said earnings per share, excluding one-off items, were C$0.59 in the final quarter of 2017, compared with C$0.63 in the same period the previous year. Analysts had on average expected earnings of C$0.58 per share, according to Thomson Reuters I/B/E/S data. (Reporting by Matt Scuffham; Editing by Tom Brown)
